The room and the breaksfast area were very clean, breakfast was very good for not-a- five-star hotel. Staff were very nice and helpful, especially the concierge. We visited Disney Land for 2 days, and we left our luggage at Rochester. When we came back we were given a room similar to what we had, and everything was again settled for our children to sleep. We found Rochester to be much much better then the hotel in Disney. When we came back to Rochester, we felt like coming back home. In summary, excellent hotel, very good value for money, very good location. We would definitely stay there again,

Reviews.Title: “Great service, in a fabulous location with OK value for money”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrotteress_10
Reviews.Content: A recently renowated small hotel on Rue de Boetie, literally 100 meters of the Champs Elysees and a 10 minute walk off the Hausmann. In addition both George V and Franklin Roosevelt metro stations are a 5 minute walk away. There are plenty of restaurants, shops and minimarkets nearby. The rooms are very clean, recently renowated and relatively well sized for Paris. The bathrooms are new. The mattresses unfortunately are not up to the sma standard and clearly were not part of the recent updates. Still Ok to sleep on, but not up to the same standard as the rest of the hotel. Also would advise to ask for a room that is not directly next to the lifts, as they make noice as the lift carriage travels in the shaft. The service from the concierge was fantastic- restaurant recommendations, reservations and organisation of tickets to theater were done smoothly, professionally and without mistakes. Overall- it is a fabulous hotel with a great decor, location and service. However the rather steep prices, below average mattresses and noicy lifts deserve it 4 stars rather than 5. Still highly recommended it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shirley50
Reviews.Content: The reception area of this hotel was really nice as were the staff. We arrived earlier then our 2pm check in which was no problem at all. Our package included a free upgrade, trip on the river and bottle of chablis. The upgrade room had two single beds which was not what we had booked so asked for a double bed wasn't a problem but we lost our upgrade and ended up in a smaller room but still very pleasant room, however I had expected more from a four star hotel room. Mini bar in the room was abit expensive but on the whole I couldn't fault this hotel. The location was excellent and although myself and my partner are far from fit we walked to all the tourist sites i,e tower,Notre dam. louvre , I would definately stay here. again.

Reviews.Title: “Well Placed”
Reviews.Author: varial
Reviews.Content: Medium size hotel, well placed, clean, but with old beds. I like the hall of the hotel, so nice for business meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: bigglesStrathaven
Reviews.Content: Great value, service excellent,off the main boulevard but only by 300 yards or so ST PHILIPE DE ROULE METRO within 50 yards of the hotel made it so easy to cross Paris and see the sights.Breakfast was usual buffet well served in choice.Take SAS busfrom CDG AIRPORT to etoile THEN a lovely walk down the CHAMPS ELYSEE AND DOWN RUE BOETIE TO HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Cavendish6
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel Superb location near the champs elysees and wonderful shopping. The staff are very friendly and provide excellent service - nothing is too much trouble! The room are well furnished and very comfortable I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the Champs Elysees”
Reviews.Author: delfing
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in a very good location, just steps away from the Champs Elysees. Room was comfortable and spacious for Paris standards, although in the ground floor without views. Breakfast was good continental quality although limited choice.

Reviews.Title: “excellant hotel with the personal touch.”
Reviews.Author: football1945
Reviews.Content: A most enjoyable experience.We last visited the hotel 20years ago for our silver wedding and returned for our 45 years of marriage anniversary.It would be nice if we can come back for our 50 years celebration.Which god willing we will achieve.Many thanks to the staff and especially Vincent in the bar .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, high service and very good location”
Reviews.Author: Hem45
Reviews.Content: This hotel has got a fantastic location, next to the Champ-Elysee. Quiet place with exemplary service. Like the cosy bar and enjoy the gym. I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Pandcal
Reviews.Content: Chosse this hotel based on (the positive) Trip Advisor reviews and was not disappointed. The hotel certainly lives up to its 4 star rating. Our room was fantastic very clean and spacious (particularly for Paris), we even had a balcony/terrace to sit outside on a remarkably warm September evening. We were located at the front of the hotel and did not experience any of the noise issues otheres have mentioned. We booked through Cresta and the deal including Eurostar was very good value, particularly when we saw the rack rate !. We had breakfast included in the price which was fortunate as the menu price is 25 Euro per person which whilst a very nice breakfast is quite steep. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is also fantastic being a mere 200 yards down a side street off the Champs Elysees.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful 4 star hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: creekside9
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Hotel Rochester in Paris. We had the pleasant surprise of an upgrade to a suite. It was beautiful The staff is very friendly and helpful. All spoke English. The bartender, Vincent, was very friendly and professional. The Hotel is in an ideal location just steps from the Metro. I will absolutely recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Not impresssed at all.”
Reviews.Author: Milangel
Reviews.Content: I am a bit dismayed by all the great Trip Advisor reviews for this hotel. I just got back and for the most part wasn't impressed. There is definitely a different star system rating in France than in the US. This hotel was rated a 4 star in France, I would give it about 2 or 3. The pictures posted ARE misleading. I stayed in a standard room and it was not nearly as large as the ones posted for standard rooms on their website. The rooms on the website that are spacious are actually triple rooms. The hotel is located across the street from a bar or restaurant where patrons get into fights until 4 am. I asked to have a room on the courtyard for some quiet. That was even worse. If your room faces the courtyard you will have to deal with the noise of other occupants who don't close their windows and talk very loudly. I had to complain about the noise level of some loud upstairs neighbors and some conventioneers who thought it was okay to blast, and I do mean blast their music with the windows open. Sound echoes in the courtyard and even closing the windows doesn't drown it out. Another occupant had to threaten to call the police on the noise makers to get them to quiet down. The hotel management, who could obviously hear the noise from the front desk because the courtyard opens onto the lobby, took forever to act on the noise, that is if they acted on it at all. Another bad thing about the rooms are the sheets and towels. I swear the sheets are only 50 thread count. They are very rough to the touch. The towels absolutely felt like sand paper. The decor was even more plain and uninviting than a Holiday Inn. There is one picture on the wall in the corner. It's not a very welcoming place to come back to after a long day of sightseeing. The TV gets 3 English channels; CNN, Sky News, and some sports channel. The bathrooms are kept very clean, but depending on the configuration of the room they can be very tiny. The first room we had was very narrow with a glass half-door instead of a shower curtain. It also had no exhaust. The second room had a larger bathroom, a shower curtain, and a small window that could be opened to let the steam escape. The elevator can only fit one person with luggage or two people without. You do get a card key which is good because some hotels in Paris give you a regular key and confiscate it when you are going out on the town . The reception area is open 24 hours. The staff is polite. We did not consult them for anything other than issues about the room. The room has an in closet safe, a mini-bar, and an Iron/ironing board only on request. The courtyard is actually very tiny and only has two tables out there. We did not bother with the breakfast.There is a supermarket up the street and a metro less than a block away, both of which came in handy. We were charged for some items from the mini-bar when we never even opened the mini-bar. The charges were removed from our bill at check-out. We were actually able to take the Air-France bus to the Arc de Triomphe from the airport and walk to the hotel to keep our expenses down. All in all this isn't a BAD hotel, it's just so incredibly blah. I don't think I would stay here again if I returned.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel after unpromising approach”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler333
Reviews.Content: We feared the worst as we walked down a narrow unttractive sidestreet from the Champs Elysees, wondering where the hotel was. Small unassuming entrance hardly recognizable as hotel until you are right upon it, but were pleasantly surprised once we entered the attractive marble and mirrors lobby with modern furniture and attractive little patio with fountain. Staff very accomodating. Room spacious and no road noise as it looked out on courtyard. Nice modern marble type bathroom, brocade curtains, nice room. Sofa in room a bit odd - looked more like a hideaway bed with a brocade cover over it than a sofa. Convenient location off of Champs Elysees for shopping but not near Louvre, Notre Dame, etc. But close to FDR Metro #1 stop on Champs Elysees which makes it easy to reach attractions. Hotel has breakfast in not very attractive breakfast room - looked like smallish buffet, not very appetizing for 25Euro so we skipped it. FREE INTERNET available at laptop in lobby. Also, on lower level very new looking small spa consisting of excercise equipment and tv, several showers, nice clean modern locker room, steam room, a massage room and soothing fountain. Looked like no one had ever used it and no one was in it.

Reviews.Title: “Most remarkable service at an excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: njcser
Reviews.Content: Nevermind what anyone says about the French. We were a group on 5 nonFrench speaking Americans yet the staff at this magnificent hotel went above and beyond what was required of them. And always with a generous spirit and a smile. Among other great things at the hotel, we were there during the ending of La Tour de France. Once the race was over we found ourselves not able to get to the tran station to get back to London because all the streets were closed. One of the excellent concierges offered to contract a car for us. That did not work because the car could not get through to the hotel. The gentleman then carried our luggage 2 blocks down to an intersection and attempted to hail two cabs - there is a limit of 4 persons in one cab. This did not work so he then carried our bags to the metro where he then proceeded to purchase tickets for us so we would not have to wait in the incredibly long line (and none of us spoke French). After that he gave my 16 yr old son explicit written directions on how to navigate the metro and get us to the train station. It all went beautifully thanks to that gentleman. After traveling to England, Scotland, Italy, Greece, and France, this was by far the best hotel, and hotel staff, experience. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: EmMcD
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and clean. The rooms were nice sized. The only main issue was we got charged for some items from the mini-bar we didn't take... odd ... but the hotel did fix it after we asked

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaOKC
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Our room was well-appointed, clean and quiet. The hotel is only 1/2 a block from a Metro stop, and five minutes walk from the Champs-Elysees. Fantastic location!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, big rooms, very comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: TXRunnerGirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great location. Located only about two blocks off the Champs Elysees, you escape the noise, hustle and bustle of the crowds. Not overly difficult to get to by the metro either. The staff was very pleasant and always helpful. Our room was good size--much bigger than most Parisan hotel rooms--and the bathroom was large as well. Our I would pass on the breakfast--it is 25 Euro for nothing spectacular. Instead, hop over to Franklin Roosevelt avenue and enjoy one of the cafes. The breakfast is much cheaper, and the outdoor seating affords a great people-watching spot of the morning commuters.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in great location !”
Reviews.Author: EdDenmark
Reviews.Content: Great location, terrific breakfast, many good cafes and restaurants in the area, near 2 metro lines... Very elegant hotel, good service, etc. We got a great deal on Travelzoo.com at approx. half the normal rate. We definitely go back again. Only complaint were the air-conditioning didn't cool the room sufficiently, and the wifi internet in the room waas much too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with BIG rooms in the middle of it all!”
Reviews.Author: Waleilia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rochester in June for three nights. It's just a block and half from the Champs Elysees, on a quiet street. The hotel is lovely, with elegant common areas and all you need from a hotel--bar, restaurant, spa and indoor and outdoor sitting areas. The hotel staff were all friendly and helpful, and the concierge made excellent suggestions for everything I asked of him. After looking at hundreds of Paris hotels online, I can authoritatively say that this hotel's rooms are WAY above average in size and amenities in the $200 range. The room was large enough to fit a desk, table and chair, and a very comfortable bed with tables on both sides. There was a minibar, safe and flat screen tv as well. The marble-clad bathroom was immaculate, with plush towels and robe, big tub and shower, and at least ten nice-quality toiletry items. A well-stocked patisserie was right around the corner, with outside seating that offered inexpensive and delicious pastries and the best quiche I've ever had. Just a few doors down was a shop where a STUFFED sandwich of lovely, crusty French bread, fresh meats and vegetables could be had for under 4 euros. A walk in the other direction brings you to the Champs Elysees, where it's all happenin'! In either direction, metro stops are close by. If you're looking for a comfortable, attractive,spacious hotel in a great location for an excellent price, the Rochester is your hotel. You won't be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Great service”
Reviews.Author: MCT672
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Rochester for a long weekend with my sister. I go tin very early in the am and well before check in. They checked my bags and I did a little exploring. On return at 12:00 - still before check-in my room was not ready but within the hour I was in my room and upgraded to a suite. I was also offered a free bottle of wine for the inconvenience of waiting. The staff was very accommodating and all spoke English. They made reservations for us, called taxi's etc. The room was perfect for us. I was with my sister and it was very large. I had been travelling over 20 days through other locations and the fact that my luggage could be accommodated easily in the room was great. The location is superb. There is a metro stop right on the corner and the Champs is down the street. We thought the breakfast was great. There have been other comments on its being limited. The room is small but I thought the selection was great, there were eggs, sausage, yogurt cheeses, cereals, and of course croissants and other breads. What more do you want? Also the staff at breakfast was great. Also this was a great value we got a discount through Travelzoo for about $190 which we think was a good price for the area. We stayed in room 801 which required going to the 7th floor and up a small flight of stairs but it was not an issue for us but could be if you had mobility issues. I would definitely come back and recommend to any of my friends

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sasafrass77
Reviews.Content: We were lucky and upgraded to a Jr. suite which was fantastic. I didn't know rooms could be that big in Paris. The staff were excellent and of course the room was fantastic. The Champs-Elysees is a bit too touristy and chaotic for my taste but the hotel was a really good deal and a nice way to close our trip.

Reviews.Title: “This was a perfect spot with attentive staff and good location.”
Reviews.Author: kmjm
Reviews.Content: Good location Comfortable, clean room Excellent staff

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - wouldn't change a thing!”
Reviews.Author: garetha77
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, extremely friendly staff. We were staying with a small child (20 months) and the staff were great with him. The hotel was extremely clean, the rooms were a good size, air con was needed and worked great and the bathroom was fully stocked with goodies! There was no noise from other guests so I assume the sound proofing was good. Breakfast was wonderful with lots to choose from - bacon, eggs, croissant, cheese, meat etc. The nearest metro is 1 minute walk away and the Champs Elysees is about five minutes walk. All in all a thoroughly enjoyable stay in a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with good rooms and location for vacationers in lovely Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Eelos
Reviews.Content: One of the great things about this hotel is its location. It's a 5 minute walk to Champ Elysees and I like that it's not directly found in Champ Elysees since that might cause some noise from all the people walking around. When you relax in your room, you can really feel the peace and serenity with the quiet atmosphere. The room and bathroom are quite clean with the beds comfortable to sleep on. I found the breakfast selection a bit limited yet fulfilling and delectable nonetheless. A nice place to stay in to enjoy lovely Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, lovely hotel in good location, and free upgrade! Four Star bargain”
Reviews.Author: CastleStone
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Expedia, just a couple blocks off the Champs Elysees it was a great place to stay. Metro station around the corner. The staff offered us a free upgrade to a suite as we were traveling with our college age daughter. Two rooms of spaciousness and a little privacy was a plus. Room was clean and spacious, (even it it's a tad bit dated) windows out to the courtyard which made it nice and quiet at night. Desk staff were pleasant and very helpful, we enjoyed our stay. The breakfast was 25 Euros per person so we never ate at the hotel but other than that we enjoyed! There is a Starbucks up the street for coffee. Eat pizza at Pizza Pino, delicious! Internet in the room was very expensive so we used the business center for free. Our daughter used the fitness center which was pretty bare bones but they had one.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location bit expensive for dinner but you are very close to the Champs-Elysees !”
Reviews.Author: Ger89
Reviews.Content: Hi, We stayed recently at the Rochester Hotel, rue la Boetie and thought it was a wonderful hotel. Brilliant location - come out the front door of hotel, turn right and 3 minutes walking will bring you onto the Champs Elysees. Hotel rooms really nice and spotlessly clean. We booked a deal that included breakfast - otherwise breakfast is €25 per person - a bit pricey but I suppose you pay for the location of the hotel. We didnt eat dinner at the hotel as again it was a bit pricey - loads of places to eat - there is a Starbucks coffee shop very close - come out of hotel, turn left and take next left - you will see the Starbucks sign - fab coffee shop called Julien in that area too. We ate in restaurant called Montechristo on the Champs Elysees - very reasonable - its on the right hand side as you turn onto the Champs Elysees from rue la Boetie. If you need any help at the hotel just ask the Concierge called Rochan - I hope he is on duty when you stay at the Rochester - he is soooooo helpful and always has a smile. G & F

Reviews.Title: “great hotel! good location”
Reviews.Author: ch0c0late_yum
Reviews.Content: my fiance decided to take me to paris as a birthday present, we chose the rochester as it looked nice in the photos and it was central, on arrival we was not dissapointed the hotel was far nicer in person than the photos and was in the heart of the city but down a nice quite back street. we arrived at 11.am and working in a hotel myself was not expecting to be given our room at this time, but to our suprise the receptionist gave us the key and our cases were taken to our room immediately, lifts were small so max 3 people to a lift, when we went into the room being in housekeeping my-self i immediately checked the room, the standards where excellent and were through the 3 day stay! there was a flat screen tv in the bedroom with a mini-bar and a kingsize bed with a table and chairs, bathroom was marble and had dressing gowns. the breakfast wasnt what i would choose there was bacon eggs, etc but not the same as in england but there was cereal fruit and pastries to choose from too. Reception were really friendly and kindly arranged taxi's and xcursions for us and kept our bags for us on the last day whilst we waited to go to the airport. Overall a great hotel you couldnt fault it at all. few tips to be aware of in paris- there are alot of beggers and alot of people pulling scams on the streets so becarefull of bags belongings etc.. if you are having steak and you normally have it medium ask for it well done!! our steaks came out practically still moo-ing! and if you are going in the winter deffintly take warm clothes and flat shoes, and an umbrella!! and make-sure you have time to go to disney land no matter what your age you will love it, best bit!!

Reviews.Title: “Not my cup of tea”
Reviews.Author: intheshuck
Reviews.Content: Got of to a bad start when we went to check in. The rooms weren't ready which is perfectly reasonable. So we decided to go for something to eat and come back later. I asked the receptionist to look after our bags. When we came back the bags were sitting in the reception area near the seats and could have been easily stolen. Once we checked in I was delayed getting to the room. My wife tipped the porter and I met him in the corridor and also tipped him. The decent thing for him to do would have been to refuse the money. I was fuming when my wife told me that she had already tipped him. On our second night we came in to the hotel and one of the staff was having a furious argument with a hotel guest and was yelling at him at the top of his voice. It was no way to treat anybody. Other than that the rooms were fine and the breakfast staff were particularly friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for a family”
Reviews.Author: KirksOnTour
Reviews.Content: We are a family with 3 young children who were looking for a break from the Xmas mayhem in the UK and we struck lucky! For those of you with +2 young children you will know how hard it is to find somewhere suitable to stay and Paris is particularly challenging. Having searched numerous hotels from guide books in Trip Advisor the Rochester looked a consistently good choice and it was. It's very well located 2 mins from the Metro and 2 mins from the Champs Elysees. You can walk to the Eiffel Tower in about 30 mins, the Louvre is about the same and the Notre Dame is about an hour away. Cross the Champs Elysees and you soon come to the Avenue Montaigne with its very exclusive fashion houses - Chanel, Hermes etc. You won't be able to go in to these shops unless you are ultra rich but its good fun to look and imagine. The hotel was smart, very tastefully decorated and the reception staff were always helpful. This is not a big gltzy hotel but if you want that in Paris you will need to pay a lot more money. We had 2 rooms next to each other which worked well, high up on the 7th floor. Everything was very comparable with a 4 star hotel in the UK. You don't get drinks making facilties in the room but you do get a minibar (an expensve option as always) but there is a supermarket across the road if you want to buy some drinks to have on hand. We emailed the hotel direct after booking through an agent to ensure we got suitable rooms for our needs and they were very obliging. Our deal included breakfast (23 euros if extra) which is a great plus when many hotels in Paris won't include breakfaats in the price. It was the usual mixture of european cuisines - meats, fruits, cereals, a small selection of hot food - and whilst the breakfast room was small we only had to wait a few times for a short while. A few top tips if you are going to Paris, especially with children. Pre-book your tickets for the Eiffel Tower because the queues are nearly always several hours long. The Batobus, a circular ferry service (Eiffel, Musee Orsay, St Germain, Notre Dame, Jardin des Plantes, Hotel de Ville, Champes Elysees) is a good way to get around. The Metro is easy to use and the Mobilisi ticket (1 to 5 days unlimited travel) is a good bet and you purchase it in the station from the automated machines (NB - you can choose English and scroll down for the 'Other Tickets' options. You can pay with your debit card.) So in summary, the Rochester is a good choice for families if you want an authentic Parisian hotel, which is very comfortable, affordable and well located.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is Fantastique!”
Reviews.Author: by_golly
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Rochester with two girl friends to celebrate my birthday. As it was my 21st I wanted something a bit special from my Parisian hotel and knew I'd found the perfect one in the Rochester, after weeks of hunting. When we arrived I was delighted with the location of the hotel, just off the champs élysées really close to metro station "Franklin Roosevelt" which had good connections to both the right and left bank. The reception staff were helpful and spoke in english when my french failed me. We arrived a little early but after waiting for a coule of minutes in the beautiful lobby, were taken to our room with no problems. I had had real difficulty finding a nice triple room in Paris, so I was thrilled with our huge room with a king sized bed for 2 of us and an extra single that had been wheeled in and added to the foot of the bed. Both beds were really comfortable and offered plenty of room, to be fair we all could have slept in the king sized bed it was so big. The bathroom was also a delight and a good size, for a Parisian hotel it was a huge bathroom! With plenty of fresh towels, soaps, shampoo etc. We had a bath with a shower above it which was perfect with plenty of hot water. Everything about the room and bathroom was clean, I have no complaints and we had air conditioning which meant our room was always a comfortable temperature. In the booking I had made breakfast was included, otherwise I think it's and extra 23euros each, which I personally wouldn't pay. The breakfast was really good. The hotel offer a selection of bread, pastries, fruit, yoghurts, cold meats and cheese and smoked salmon. They also have hot breakfasts of egg, bacon and sausage. Overall The trip was fantastique we had no problems with our room, the service or the food and checking out was just as easy as checking in. A brilliant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Odeh12345
Reviews.Content: Rochester and its staff were just outstanding in every aspect

Reviews.Title: “Rochesters was an excellent choice!!”
Reviews.Author: snikoo
Reviews.Content: The Rochester Champs-Elysees hotel was a delightful little hotel in the heart of Paris. The staff was so helpful especially the concierge, Roshan, who was extremely responsive to all my needs...and always with a smile! The hotel is ideally located in the middle of all the attractions! The Champs-Elysees is a couple of blocks away and the shopping is wonderful!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: Dublin7
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location just 2 minutes walk from Champs Elysees. Room was a junior suite, loads of space and well maintained. Breakfast fairly typical for a paris hotel with a great selection and the breakfast room was well staffed. The concierge was very helpful on the morning of departure but the male receptionist on both evenings was not at all welcoming. The check in experience was borderline rude. The checkout on sunday morning was the complete opposite efficient and polite. I would highly recommend this hotel as a base for visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Overall 4 star BUT . . .”
Reviews.Author: ndsmc
Reviews.Content: Location great, 3 blocks from Champs Elysee. Close enough for convenience, far enough to be quiet at night. Literally steps from a metro stop. Patisserie, Starbucks and supermarket 1 block away and far enough from Champs Elysee to be uncrowded. Hotel rooms (we had 2 junior suites for a family of 5 with adult children) were as advertised. Nice beds (firm), crisp linens, furniture in good condition. Now for the BUT . . .This hotel was acceptable for the price (ie. location and all above) but the desk staff and especiallly the concierge were inadequate for the price we paid. They were sometimes put out by our simple requests and could rarely complete the tasks for a lack of knowledge or initiative (eg. could not telll us how long it would take to get to certain common locations) and when we left the hotel to load our luggage into the van, not a single one of the 4 staff present helped us. They simply said "Au revoir". Bottom line, if you have traveled frequently and can map out your own schedule and route, you would find the advantages outweigh the drawbacks and the hotel is worth the cost. If you rely heavily on the concierge, I would pick a different hotel to feel that you got what you paid for.

Reviews.Title: “we liked it at the Rochester”
Reviews.Author: LoveParis16
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at this hotel: the best feature of it is its location practically on Faubourg St Honore, within easy walking distance from Champs Elysees, The Elysee Palace. The room was good size (especially for Paris!), well appointed, the bath facilities, although slightly narrow, excellent. Service (of the room) was very good, the concierge services though need improving (the wake up call was never made, the taxis came either too early - 1o min - with the meter running, or too late - 25 min.) The registration staff was very prompt and courteous. The common areas, the lobby , the exterior of the hotel look quite impressive and very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Short Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: mhcooper
Reviews.Content: Great Location - hotel is very close to my office, shopping and the metro (great little bakery around the corner that is open early as well as a Starbucks!); Rooms are not the fanciest but has everything you want on a business trip or an active site seeing trip to the city; Very easy to book with their online system and staff is very responsive to letting you know if there is availability; No surprises at check-in and room was ready early;

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: IamJay
Reviews.Content: rooms are on the small side, service is good, non personal though. Location is okay. We will come back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: travelguy5266
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel as part of our 25 year wedding anniversary and found it to be welcoming and friendly. The concierge was particularly helpful and friendly and greatly assisted us with arrangements and in finding our way round Paris. Food was excellent and the breakfast buffet offered excellent choice. The Resturaunt was very clean and the service friendly and efficient. The rooms were of good size, well furnished and decorated and spotlessly clean. The hotel is ideally situated about 4 minutes walk from the centre of the Champs Elleyse. There is a Metro station 2 minutes from the hotel entrance. We would certainly recommend the hotel to friends and will use it again on our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nostalgic trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: JaneN60
Reviews.Content: My husbandand and I have just returned from a nostalgic trip to Paris (we used to live on the outskirts of Paris 20 years ago). Paris is wonderful and your hotel was splendid. We did not expect such a good standard of cleanliness, luxury and romatric charm from a 3 night city break trip. Wonderful rooms (clean linen and towels every day), very friendly staff, and so near the heart of Paris. We will return. Jane and Paul Neale

Reviews.Title: “Good central location”
Reviews.Author: Tresc0
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth time of staying at this hotel. Its clean and tidy, but rooms can vary in size. Its in a good location with many restaurants, cafes in close proximity. Reception staff not so friendly this time as on previous occasions though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jennaainge
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel. From the moment we checked in the staff couldn't be more friendly. Hotel was to a good standard and even had laptops you could use in the lobby to arrange your sightseeing! Our room was facing the road so we asked to be moved and they moved us to a lovely room. The first room facing the road was very noisy so best to ask for a room facing the courtyard! From our room there was a nice view of the Eiffel Tower! Perfect! Breakfast was really nice too. Buffet brakfast was included in our trip. It was the normal continental style but also on the buffet table was hot bacon, sausages and scrambled egg, incase you're wanting something hot! There's a metro station just around the corner, about 20-30 seconds walk so that made getting around very easy. Concierge are on hand to help with most things from booking taxi's, Helping you with directions and trains etc! Would stay there if we went again!

Reviews.Title: “relaxing”
Reviews.Author: marinali
Reviews.Content: staff was friendly, room clean and neat a bit small size, very good location, reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Rochester”
Reviews.Author: qbranch
Reviews.Content: Wow what a suprise, a hotel in Paris with BIG rooms, ask for the rooms overlooking the courtyard as this will ensure that the din of the Taxis picking people up at 5 in the morning cannot be heard. Breakfast (23 euros unless part of your package) is excellent and lasts till 2pm!! Hotel staff can't do enough for you and they make it all worthwhile. All in all a very pleasant suprise and one I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dd1121
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on Trip Advisor last year when my son and I went to Paris for 5 days. It was all I had hoped for - the room was lovely, a small suite with no view but still charming. It's a walk from the Arc de Triumphe and I don't think any of the rooms have a great view but it really is a great little hotel and close to the Metro which made travel very easy.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Central, Spot on!”
Reviews.Author: LynneUK_8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights in Paris as part of a trip to combine Paris and London. We arrived on the Eurostar at Sunday lunchtime and the taxi to the hotel from the Gare du Nord cost around 10 Euros. As a tip, give Paris a miss on a Sunday - it's dead. My first impression was that the hotel is very gold! Reception is gleaming brass and marble, and I reckon they put yellow lightbulbs in! The hotel is spotlessly clean and has lovely room amenities. The minibar is of course expensive! The bathroom has everything you need and the TV in the room has lots of channels including a movie channel that showed occasional movies in English! To my surprise I discovered that American movies are right - you can see the Eiffel Tower from the hotel room! You had to lean out and twist a bit, but there it was... My French is rusty to say the least but this was not a problem in the Rochester. There were people from lots of different countries staying at the hotel and the staff communicated well with them all. Shops and cashpoints are very close and convenient, and there is a bar or a restaurant every few doors! There is also a 24 hour pharmacy on the opposite end of the street (closer to the Champs-Elysses). General points about our trip to Paris: Everywhere was close and within walking distance. We walked to the Eiffel Tower on the first day, and on the second day we bought a 2-day bus ticket with Les Cars Rouge. It takes you round the main sights in about 2 1/2 hours, or you can get on and off as you like. The ticket was around 20 Euros and lasts 2 days, so we used it a lot for the rest of our visit! Sometimes the driving was a little exhilarating but I have a feeling it's all part of the Paris experience. 2 days was not enough to see everything we wanted to see, and we will definitely return. I would not hesitate to go back to the Rochester again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: alexia_a
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my finacee and I for 30/12/2007-01/01/2008 I thought I got an excellent deal with lastminute.com the accommodation (room only basis) and BA flights for just under £500GBP for both of us because of this my friend and her boyfriend joined us. I looked the hotel on trip advisor before booking and was happy to see all of the great reviews and when I arrived it was even better! We arrived at CDG airport and decided before hand that we would take the metro to the hotel as a taxi transfer was 140EUR. It took about 2 hours from the airport to the hotel you have to change lines twice. After the long journey to the nearest station to the hotel (St Phillipe de Roue) once we came out we could see the hotel right in front of us which was a relief after the long journey. When we arrived at the hotel we were very impressed inside and out the decor was lovely. The check in was quick and we were escorted to our room. As soon as I went in the room it did smell a bit of stale smoke (I am a non smoker) but after a minute I didnt notice it. The room decor was of a very high standard and spotless. You could tell it had been recently renovated. If staying at this hotel you should request a room facing the court yard as my friend'd room was not and she could hear the noise from the street. The hotel had two laptops in the lobbby area where you could have free internet access which I thought was great, but they should really have a time limit as people do stay n it for hours. The location of the hotel was excellent! 5 minute walk to the Champs Elysee. The staff at all times were very helpful and even let us check out at 2pm instead of 12pm. The only down side of the trip which has nothing to do with the accommodation is how expensive everything was. a can of coke in a cafe on the Champs Elysee was 6 EUR!!! Overall I was extreamely impressed with the hotel and I would 100% go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not great...Not terrible”
Reviews.Author: plumNewOrleans
Reviews.Content: The Rochester Champs Elysees is a decent enough hotel, but for the price and its star rating, you could definitely do much, much better. Its sister hotel, the Franklin Roosevelt is only 5 or six blocks away, costs the same and is far superior. The photos of the rooms that other reviewers have posted are pretty accurate of how the hotel looks. The Good: The hotel is on the Rue la Boetie, which is only two blocks from the Champs Elysees, near the rond point FDR. Decent sized rooms. There is free internet and the staff is helpful, if not overly competent. (After paying, I asked a question about my bill and watched as the desk attendant fished a copy of my bill out of the trash with my credit card number, expiration date and name written across the top...eek!) The Bad: Pancake-like pillows, one extra blanket for a twin room, not-too-comfortable beds and a general worn-out and tired look to the rooms. And, of course, that credit card issue... One night at the Rochester isn't going to be unbearable, but I wouldn't stay any longer than that.

Reviews.Title: “Good 4 star - central location”
Reviews.Author: Bobs-big-vacation
Reviews.Content: This is a well located easy to find 4 star just off the Champs-Elysees and steps away from the St Phillippe du roule metro. On arrival, there was a problem with the room. The room smelled fausty from cigarette smoke and despite the claim from reception that this could not be, as it's against the law to smoke in rooms ...(or something similar...so why are there ashtrays left in rooms and outside every lift?) ...we were given the choice of 4 other rooms to view (and smell!) Removed to a far larger and more sweetly smelling room, the weekend recovered from a shaky start by such helpful service. The room itself was clean, well appointed, and equipped with a large bathroom. Breakfast had excellent choice for a continental / French breakfast with attentive service.

Reviews.Title: “SPOTLESSLY CLEAN, EXCELLENT LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: Lumsa
Reviews.Content: I took my 22-year-old daughter to Paris as a graduation present this year and we stayed at the Rochester. We have both travelled extensively throughout N.A. and Europe and this hotel was EXCELLENT VALUE for the money. We are both "clean freaks" and the hotel was spotless!! Our room was thoroughly cleaned each day...the bed linens were crisp and clean, the bathroom was always sparkling clean with lots of fresh towels available. The bathroom was done in marble...we had one king-sized bed and it was HUGE...more like a California King..and soooo comfortable. The location was superb. You walk about 2 blocks to the Champs Elysee..(we walked day & nite..lots of people around). The cabfare you save by staying at this location is considerable. From here, we walked everywhere, which is the way to see Paris! The Rochester is just blocks from L'arc de triumphe where you can catch the subway to just about anywhere.....or walk to Bato Bus which is the BEST mode of transportation to see all the of tourist sites if you don't want to walk. I would definitely stay at the Rochester again. The other hotels in the same general location are not worth spending more for. The only thing I would say about staying here or at any other hotel in Paris is that the price for including breakfast is not worth it ( for us anyway) ...we only wanted pastry and coffe in the morning and you can just walk up to the Champs and buy it for a fraction of the cost; sit down outside the cafe and "people watch"

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: bddoughty
Reviews.Content: October 23, 2007 for eight nights Though check-in was a bit disorienting as French TV was filming in the Lobby making it difficult for me to locate the lift through the bright lights and what seemed like a sea of people, the Rochester Champs Elysees could not have been a better choice. The staff are efficient, though certainly not overly friendly, it is France after all; nonetheless, they were most responsive, particularly to my needs relating to an urgent need to check email and follow up with several phone calls to home due to an emergency. I was most grateful. The Hotel Lobby is very tasteful, the breakfast room small but nice, the breakfast was wonderfully plentiful with a wide variety of choices, healthy and not so healthy. Though my first room was larger than the second, I choose to move to a quieter location overlooking the inner courtyard and away from the lift as the noise from the lift produced an overwhelmingly annoying low level scratching sound that just about drove me insane. I believe it was #609. I moved to #311 which as noted was smaller but it was blissfully quiet. A large double French window that fully opened onto the courtyard. Flat Screen TV, Desk, Chair and lots of closet space with a safety box. The bath was a bit small though polished. Shower/tub with lots of bath soaps and gels supplied. Housekeeping Great, though a bit loud in the morning. Location is truly minutes from the Champs Elysees in one direction and Rue du Faubourg Saint-Honore in the other direction. Most everything you need within a very short distance. Overall, this is a well managed property, tasteful with aspects of elegance here and there. Acquired the room through United Vacations at a very good rate. Wouldn’t think anyone would be disappointed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: grangster
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a second honeymoon in Paris. Hotel was clean; modern and in the center of the Champs. The room we stayed in was spacious and clean. The only thing we will tell all travelers is that if you are seeking to spend a great deal of time on the left bank (especially in the evening and late evening hours) then this hotel may not be in the ideal location for you. Notwithstanding the above, the hotel is adjacent to the Champs and near two metro stops. We could not be any happier with our selection.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THIS HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: slcSF
Reviews.Content: The jr. suite was perfect for my 16 and 11 yr old daughters and me on our first visit to Paris during the last week of June '07. The rooms and the hotel were exactly as they appeared on the hotel website. The rooms and bath were clean and spacious -- very comfortable for 3. The daybed (not pullout) in the outer room was very comfortable. We had 2 flat-screen TVs and nice robes and towels. The hotel staff was friendly and accommodating. I needed milk to take with some medication just as the restaurant staff was setting up for breakfast. Although I was more than hapy to pay for the milk, it was given to me generously and graciously. As others have noted, the location is quiet and very convenient to the Metro. The major line to the Louvre is a 5 minute walk away on the Champs Elysees, and another line to the Eiffel Tower and Boulevard Haussmann is steps away. Other neighborhood amenities include a boulangerie and grocery store within a few yards of the hotel . Dalloyau teahouse and pastries is a couple of blocks away on the elegant Faubourg Saint-Honore. Their chocolates and pastries are not to be believed, and they offer gourmet food to go that rivals anything we've had in San Francisco, although it does not come cheap. B of A customers will find a no-fee Paribas branch with ATMs half a block away. The proximity to Champs Elysees allowed my daughters to have some independence in a safe environment. In short, I can't say enough good things about this wonderful hotel. We would come back in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star experience”
Reviews.Author: Baskaat
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Rochester in August and I cannot recommend it as a four star experience. The room's carpeting was stained, there was mold in the shower and the towels were horrible. Most of the staff were nice amd spoke excellent English. There is a metro stop a few steps away, but you need to change trains at the next station to get anywhere near the major tourist destinations. As described in previous reviews, the internet hardly ever worked. We did get a courtyard room and it was pretty quiet. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: rachie-m-2004
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during August. The Hotel is in an excellent location, there is a tube stop just a half minute walk away and the Champs elysees just a 5 minute walk. The mini bar prices were very expensive, but there is a supermarket across the road which was very useful. We had breakfast bought to our room every morning with a selection of croissants, rolls, yogurt and fruit. The room was bright, clean and nicely decorated and overlooked the small courtyard. All in all we had an excellent time and would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

HotelInfo.Name: Rochester Champs-Elysees Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 92 rue la Boetie, 75008 Paris, France
